issue.subject: New tool : EasySDI EXTRACT
issue.description:
EXTRACT is a Java web application that connects to easySDI shop with "SHOP'S REST WS":https://forge.easysdi.org/projects/easysdi/wiki/4_shop_rest to automate order processing.
It connects to ETLs (FME for example) and other systems _via_ plugins to gather data for the order.


EXTRACT Has been accepted on PSC meeting 7th mars 2017


Main features are : 
- import orders from easySDI SHOP
- filter and dispatch orders according properties (format, client, perimeters...)
- process orders according to a parameterized treatment (1 to n tasks)
- load task plugins to achieve specific tasks (validation, add remark,  launch FME desktop/server jobs,...)
- export results to easySDI SHOP

custom_fields.name: Functional impact
custom_fields.value:
EXTRACT has no impact on current easySDI perimeter since it behaves like a third-party tool and interact with easySDI SHOP via the REST interface.

It can be installed on the same instance as easySDI or on a remote server. EXTRACT has no access to easySDI database since it has its own database.

custom_fields.name: Ergonomic impact
custom_fields.value: EXTRACT has no impact on easySDI GUI neither ergonomic impact on any currents screens.

journals.notes: @Xavier: can you please fill this issue with EXTRACT description + functional/ergonomic impacts ? It will be the issue for the initial commit (V1) of EXTRACT delivered by arx iT.

EXTRACT is a Java web application that connects to easySDI shop with "SHOP'S REST WS":https://forge.easysdi.org/projects/easysdi/wiki/4_shop_rest to automate order processing.

details.new_value:
EXTRACT is a Java web application that connects to easySDI shop with "SHOP'S REST WS":https://forge.easysdi.org/projects/easysdi/wiki/4_shop_rest to automate order processing.
It connects to ETLs (FME for example) and other systems _via_ plugins to gather data for the order.


EXTRACT Has been accepted on PSC meeting 7th mars 2017


Main features are : 
- import orders from easySDI SHOP
- filter and dispatch orders according properties (format, client, perimeters...)
- process orders according to a parameterized treatment (1 to n tasks)
- load task plugins to achieve specific tasks (validation, add remark,  launch FME desktop/server jobs,...)
- export results to easySDI SHOP

EXTRACT has no impact on current easySDI perimeter since it behaves like a third-party tool and interact with easySDI SHOP via the REST interface.

It can be installed on the same instance as easySDI or on a remote server. EXTRACT has no access to easySDI database since it has its own database.
EXTRACT has no impact on easySDI GUI neither ergonomic impact on any currents screens.

journals.notes:
EXTRACT is ready to be integrated to easySDI forge since V1.0 stable is available since mid-september.

Documentation is currently available as "PDF/word" format and will be soon added to this news wiki section : https://forge.easysdi.org/projects/easysdi/wiki/Extract_Installation?parent=4
ArxIt (https://forge.easysdi.org/users/1670) is ready to commit all EXTRACT code in the coming weeks.
*I propose to formely discuss this issue next week as we have a Steering Committee on 6.10 (11am).*

EXTRACT integration has been formely validated by PSC.
The code is about to be commit in SVN by ArxIT.

@Helene
Please can you change status to "accepted" (I cannot do that)
Arxit branch merged in ASIT VD 4.4.X branch
